page.title: 17Hargreaves wood.(May 1985)
page.content: A couple of days ago we went to Hargreaves wood. Hargreaves wood is a wood on top of a hill which is a beautiful and interesting place. It has got a lot of wildlife and beautiful flowers. The map reference _ is 098106. On the way there we had a look at the fields around. Most of them were arable, but some were grass.We saw quite a lot of animals: crows, mice, ladybirds and spiders. We also saw rabbit and badger tracks. We found what could have been badger setts or fox earths.{Flowers}: We saw plenty of bluebells as it is the right time of year(May). Lords and Ladies were flourishing, and we saw docks. (Docks are a kind of remedy for nettle stings). There were many nettles including the yellow kind. Also seen: ground ivy,stitchwort,campions.This wood has been reduced by local farmers
